newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Sayansk Aluminium wants protection against imports.
newsitem.headline: Sayansk Aluminium wants protection against imports.

text.p: Russia's Sayansk Aluminium called on Wednesday for protectionist measures against foreign aluminium products and said it would seek better prices for raw materials, shipping and energy.
Sayansk, Russia's third largest primary aluminium producer, gave no dates or indication of the levels it would seek to pay for supplies and transport.
It said in a statement it had planned negotiations with suppliers of raw materials to secure lower prices in exchange for payment guarantees.

It would also petition Russia to close the domestic market to foreign aluminium products and added that Russian rolled aluminium firms would improve if primary producers focused on the domestic market.
"A proposal to the government has been prepared on protectionist measures aiming to close the Russian market to the penetration of imports made from aluminium," it said.
OAO Sayansky Alyuminievy Zavod also said it would try to negotiate long-term freight and electricity price agreements with Russia's railways ministry and Unified Energy System, RAO UES, respectively.
Electricity and transport prices affect the price of primary aluminium, especially among major Russian producers, which are located far from major markets in Siberia.
Sayansk said electricity prices for domestic producers were twice as high as for Western producers.

Sayansk, a primary aluminium producer, also has a foil-making subsidiary, Sayanal, which company leaders have said plans to increase its domestic sales, partly at the expense of imported foreign packaging materials.
